title: The Multiplying Orchard
description: The Full Vision: Sending Leaders to Multiply the Kingdom

blocks.text: Session #10
The Multiplying Orchard

Congratulations, leader! You have completed the Neighborhood Church Leadership Course. You have grown deeper in BE (your roots in Christ), BLESS (your fruit for the world), and BELONG (your life in the spiritual family). Now the vision is to multiply - to send and equip others to do the same.

The tree analogy from Session 1 is now the orchard: roots deep in Christ, branches reaching out to bless, and fruit that multiplies for the Kingdom. Your leadership legacy is not just what you do - it is the leaders you raise up who raise up others.
And what you have heard from me in the presence of many witnesses entrust to faithful men, who will be able to teach others also.

And Jesus came and said to them, “All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me. Go therefore and make disciples of all nations… teaching them to observe all that I have commanded you. And behold, I am with you always, to the end of the age.”

blocks.text: Summary Teaching

The orchard is not finished when the trees grow tall - it is finished when the trees produce fruit that plants new orchards. Jesus didn’t stop with twelve disciples; He sent them to make more. Paul didn’t stop with Timothy; he told him to entrust the truth to faithful men who would teach others also.

Your leadership at Neighborhood Church is now part of this multiplication story. Every leader you raise up who raises up others is fruit that abides. The spiritual family grows when we send leaders from our homes, neighborhoods, and church into the harvest.
Orchard Snapshot (a quick growth exercise)

Close your eyes for 30 seconds and picture the orchard God is growing through your life. Ask the Holy Spirit: “Who is one person I can send this year to multiply what I have learned?” Write the name and one next step.
